key_channel_insights.line_content: Though primarily higher than the website (about 80% of the time), OTA fares show a small decline from the previous month and a gradual rise in parity.
Over 85% of itineraries remain cheaper via metasearch compared to direct booking, with minimal unlisted or higher fares.
Around 80% of GDS fares are higher, yet parity has modestly increased to nearly 17% with stable minimal lower and missing instances.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Fares priced higher on the channel account for over 80% of observations, slightly down from 83% one month ago.
Website offers not found on the channel remain consistently low, hovering near 2% across all periods.
Same-price instances increased from 14% one month ago to nearly 17% this week, pointing to closer alignment.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: OTA N/A frequency decreased from 2.6% last month to around 1.8% this week, indicating minimal unlisted fares.
Parity fares expanded from 13.8% to 16.6% over the month, reflecting a modest move toward equal pricing.
Under 1% of fare checks show the channel beating the website, with negligible shifts week to week.
Remains the primary outcome at about 81%, though down slightly from 83% last month.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 81% of short-haul fares are channel-higher, down from 83% last month, while same fares climbed slightly above 16%.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: In Australia, fares follow the same pattern: the channel is higher around 81% of the time, with minimal channel-lower cases.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Channel-higher leads at 78%, slightly below last month’s 79%. Same fares rose to nearly 18%, up from 17%.
Channel-higher dips to 86%, down nearly five points from the previous week, while same fares improve from 8% to 14%.

mse_highlights.line_content: Over 85% of recent itineraries on this channel are lower-priced than the direct site.
Around 14% of fares remained equal to the website, reflecting minimal direct-channel competition.
MSE offered nearly all fares; unavailability or higher pricing remained under 1%.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Barely 0.4% of itineraries showed no metasearch price; slightly higher than previous weeks.
Around 14.2% matched the airline site, up slightly from 13.5% in the prior week.
Dominant at over 85% of searches; average fares about 6% under the direct site range.
Effectively negligible with zero recorded occurrences in the last week.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: MSE LOWER holds at 85% with minimal changes week to week; same fares remain near 14%.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Reflects short-haul trends: over 85% lower-priced, around 14% identical, near-zero higher or missing.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 95% of fares are cheaper on MSE, showing consistent slight declines in share from month to month.
Lower MSE fares near 68% last week, slightly down from nearly 71% the prior month.

gds_highlights.line_content: Around 80% of itineraries in GDS show higher fares than the website, though there is a minor downward trend from previous month.
Approximately 17% of fares remain at parity, reflecting a modest increase compared with one month ago.
Both GDS Lower and unavailable offers are below 1% and show no major swings week over week.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Near 0% incidence week to week, with a slight 0.7% incidence noted last month on a close-in basis.
Holds around 17% share in GDS, rising slightly by 3% compared to one month ago.
Below 1% share, showing negligible changes from prior periods.
Dominant at over 80% of itineraries, with small dips from prior month but still the leading comparison outcome.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: GDS Higher remains steady at about 82%, with Same pricing near 17% and minimal instances of GDS Lower or unavailable offers.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Patterns mirror overall short-haul trends: around 80% of GDS itineraries are higher, 17% at parity, and less than 1% unlisted or lower.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: GDS Higher sits near 80% while Same fares are around 20%. GDS Lower and unavailable fares remain under 1%.
GDS Higher climbs closer to 86–90%, with Same pricing slightly below 14%. No major shifts observed in other categories.
